      • buildMap

        @NotNull
protected java.util.Map<K,V> buildMap(@NotNull
                                  java.util.List<com.brianmearns.crafter.MapBuilder.DefaultMapBuilder.Entry<K,V>> entries)
        Helper function called from get() to actually build and populate the map with the given entries. This makes it easier to override if you want to create a different type of map. This will typically delegate to createMap(int).

      • createMap

        @NotNull
protected java.util.Map<K,V> createMap(int size)
        Helper methods called by buildMap(List) to create the initial map. This is the easiest way to override the implementation of the Map interface you want to use.
        Parameters:
        size - The approximate number of entries that the map will need to hold initially.

      • apply

        public MapBuilder<K,V> apply(com.google.common.base.Function<MapBuilder<K,V>,java.lang.Void> function)
        Description copied from class: MapBuilder
        Apply the given function to this object, and return this object again.

        This is simply a way to add some arbitrary code in the middle of a chain of method invocations. You could use the Function to perform some complex logic to configure the builder, for instance.

        The return value of the function is ignored, but for safety and clarity, it should be a void return.

        Specified by:
        apply in class MapBuilder<K,V>
        Parameters:
        function - The Function to be invoked on this object.
        Returns:
        This MapBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.
